text:
Spring break: It’s the one event college students look forward to all year. After being locked away in the classroom, or tiny (yet well-appointed) dorm room), doing assignments and projects, you can’t wait to escape the stress of school and embark on an adventure! Whether you’re headed to Florida, Tulum, or Cancun with your besties, or staycationing at your pal’s pool, now that you’ve got a destination, the next thing you need to focus on is what to bring.

To help you prepare for your upcoming travels (we know you’re eager to get to that tropical destination, volunteer location, or cozy home to hunker down in), we composed the ultimate college spring break packing list so you can fret less and focus your attention on having fun, or doing good, in the sun. Our must-haves include cute bathing suits and maxis for apres-beach, ‘gram-worthy loungewear (you are on vacation, after all!), and of course, a TikTok-approved book. Check out our list below!

CLOTHES

Tip: Make the most of your break by choosing pieces that can be mixed and matched to create a bunch of looks!

3 DAY DRESSES

A comfy dress (with pockets!) for hanging by your bestie’s pool

A flowy, sexy dress for those days you want to feel dressier (without the extra effort)

A sleek ribbed dress for city sightseeing

2 GOING OUT DRESSES

A white dress to complement your sunkissed glow

A bright, two-piece dress for dancing the night away

2 MATCHING SETS

An elevated top and matching bottoms that give you endless outfit options

A light, breezy set that will keep you cool and looking super chic

4 TOPS

A Y2K-inspired tube top with a matching button-up shirt

A vibrant crop top to add a pop of color to your look

A lightweight knit for breezy nights by the water

A tie-front top that’s perfect for dressing up cutoffs or pairing with a skirt

3 PAIRS OF BOTTOMS

A laid-back yet sexy midi skirt

Classic cutoffs that go with literally everything

A neutral midi skirt that will make colorful tops, shoes, and accessories stand out

2 SWIMSUITS AND 2 COVERUPS

A glittery, one-shoulder bikini top and matching bottoms that feel straight out of the early 2000s

A bold one-piece with fun cutouts

A stylish, sexy coverup skirt that provides the perfect amount of coverage

Boho-inspired crochet pants that can be worn by the pool or at a music festival

2 LOUNGE LOOKS

A comfy jumpsuit that’s perfect for traveling or binging your fave TV show

A cozy top and matching lounge pants you can wear at home or on the go

2 PAIRS OF SHOES

Comfy, cute slides that go from sand to sidewalk with ease (and they come in SO many colors!)

Platform wedges that are easy to walk in while still giving you some height

4 ACCESSORIES

A straw tote bag that’s perfect for beach days and nights on the town

A beaded clutch you can dress down in the daytime and dress up for a night out

A wide-brim hat to keep your face out of the sun

Trendy sunglasses (because you can’t do spring break without some cute sunnies!)

Beach Bag

Tip: Get double duty out of your oversized beach bag by using it as your carry-on/personal item for traveling to your spring break destination. Plus, it’ll ensure you have all your important items next to you at all times.

Ticket(s) (for traveling and any events you’re attending)

Cell phone

ID (if you’re staying within the U.S., use your driver’s license, or if you’re traveling abroad, bring your passport!)

Sunglasses

Medications

Gum

Wallet (keep some cash on you in case you run into any issues with your cards)

Snacks

Reusable water bottle (make sure it’s empty if you’re going through airport security!)

Antibacterial gel

Headphones

A bathingsuit and cover-up (in case your luggage gets delayed!)

Toiletries

Sunscreen

Shampoo, conditioner, and soap

Dry shampoo

Face wash

Pimple patches

Deodorant

Toothbrush and toothpaste

Razor and shaving cream

Hairbrush

Hairstyling tools (i.e. hairdryer and curling iron for those beach waves)

Hair ties

Makeup

Face masks (for those relaxation days)

Tweezers

A mini first aid kit

Feminine hygiene products

Miscellaneous

Beach towel

Disposable camera (so you don’t have to worry about your phone or nice camera getting sandy or wet!)

Chargers (get a cheap portable phone charger for long days at the beach or while you’re en route)

A good beach read

Koozies (May you always have a cool—and cute!—drink in your hand)

Mini emergency/first aid kit

Zip-lock bag or waterproof pouch for your wet swimsuit

Corkscrew

Check off all the items on this list and you’ll be sure to have the best. spring. break. ever. Happy vacay!
